content.description: A beautiful line on a really cool cliff band way at the back of the old green (now yellow blazed) trail in pleasant hill preserve in lyme.  Near the interection (downhill 100-200 yards)with the red blazed trail. Trail actually traverses along the top of the cliff band for a little while.           Climb this on a perfect fall day with the sun lighting up the rock and the mt laurel casting shadows on the rock.
content.protection: Pad and a spotter for company.
content.location: Climb the obvious zig zagging crack up the center of the face. Find the horn up top and top out.   The crux is the top out which goes at V2 if the top out is covered in ice and snow ;) .    The Bonzai (okay mt laurel) tree is beautiful and very mature so please don't cut it down.

content.description: Beautiful woodlands covered in granite boulders and granite and gneiss cliff bands. Lots of hiking trails cover the hills of lyme and it's a great place to explore, in my opinion one of the more scenic areas of Connecticut.  Pleasant Hill Preserve is off Macintosh Rd,   Which is off Mt. archer Rd, which is off the 156 in lyme. The rock is bulletproof granite.
